text:
A solid spot for affordable mala xiangguo cravings, Ri Ri Hong is a chain eatery that delivers flavorful hits like the mapo tofu $7 (generous pork mince, silky sauce) and fried long beans $6 (crispy, loaded with numbing hua jiao peppers). The Qing jiao kao yu $22 (green chili fish), however, missed the mark—deep-fried instead of grilled, it leaned greasy, and the hua jiao spice was muted, replaced by a milder localized green chili kick.

Portions are decent for the price, but unfortunately the white rice was stale and hard when we dined there. Overall, a satisfying meal for spice lovers seeking value, though the kao yu grilled fish and rice need tweaking. Stick to the classics here for a fuss-free mala fix!
Well-priced, but spice levels are very inconsistent; however it’s noticeably milder than average.
Not a bad mala place and affordable
Portion damn small. Got the mala xiang guo, 12.40sgd only 1 meat
